alert.note: Alert for Hansford (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 29 at 12:33AM CDT until May 30 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas... Palo Duro Creek at Spearman 6W affecting Hansford County. .Several rounds of heavy rainfall from thunderstorms is causing the potential for significant rise at Palo Duro Creek near Spearman. For the Palo Duro Creek...including Spearman 6W...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Palo Duro Creek at Spearman 6W. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, The creek is at bankfull stage. Some minor overbank flooding occurs and cattle in the floodplain may be threatened. At 12.0 feet, Moderate overbank flooding occurs. Cattle are threatened and damage to fences is possible * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 4.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.5 feet this morning. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 1245 PM CDT.
